title: Château Capdet 2014  Listrac-Médoc
description: There is plenty of Merlot in this ripe wine which is produced in the Listrac cooperative. Spice and attractive tannins give the wine structure and perfume. They contrast with the juicy blackberry fruits and fine crisp acidity. The wine will be ready to drink from 2021.

title: Château de Tourteyron 2014  Médoc
description: This is a soft ripe wine. It has already delicious red fruits and gentle tannins. With a generous rich palate, it is full bodied and packed with jammy Merlot flavors. The wine will be ready to drink soon, certainly by late 2017.

title: Château du Bois Chantant 2014 Cuvée Laurence H.  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: The wine is fruity and also textured. The acidity and dry tannin and wood flavors reveal a wine that will need to develop. It has weight and potential richness that will come out over the next couple of years. Drink this wine from 2018.

title: Château du Raux 2013  Haut-Médoc
description: The wine has bright red fruits and lively acidity. It tastes light with only an edge of tannin to give the wine its shape. With a juicy aftertaste, it will mature quickly. Drink from 2018.

title: Bonacchi 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Dark-skinned berry and baking spice aromas lead the nose. The easygoing palate offers juicy black cherry and mocha flavors with a touch of white pepper. Dusty tannins leave a drying finish. Drink through 2021.

title: Bonacchi 2012 Casalino  (Brunello di Montalcino)
description: This opens with subdued black-skinned fruit and baking spice aromas. The palate is straightforward and easygoing, with black cherry, tilled soil and leather alongside flavors supported by firm tannins. Enjoy through 2021.

title: Bradley 2015 Dry Riesling (Elkton Oregon)
description: The winery notes that these vines were planted in 1983, and the wine offers generous dry extract along with dried apple fruit. It's lightly tawny in color, with sappy acids. Best to drink up in 2017.

title: Château Marquisat de Binet 2012 Cuvée Abel  (Montagne-Saint-Émilion)
description: The wine is tight with considerable tannins over the black-currant fruit. That makes for a structured dark wine with black-plum skins giving a firm texture. The wine will need time. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Patache d'Aux 2014  Médoc
description: Named after the stagecoach stop just outside the chateau, this is a crisp wine, still underlined with wood, although with plenty of attractive black-currant acidity and fruit flavors. It will be ready to drink from 2020.

title: Château Taffard de Blaignan 2014  Médoc
description: This is a bright and fruity wine from a blend of 50-50 Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Black-currant fruit and a touch of spice from wood aging leave a wine that is juicy, packed with fruitiness and likely to be ready to drink soon. D0rink from 2019.

title: Château Tour Haut-Caussan 2014  Médoc
description: A half-and-half blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon has yielded a plush wine that also has firm tannins. With its juicy blackberries, acidity and wood aging, the wine is set for slow aging. Drink from 2020.

title: Broken Earth 2011 Petit Verdot (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh blueberry, burned caramel, black licorice and sage scents show on the nose of this bottling of a variety that doesn't often get its own stage. The tannins are light but ever-present, framing black plum, elderberry, thyme and peppercorn flavors. It's not as rich or dense as similar wines but is nevertheless a nice sipper.

title: Sensi 2015 Vegante  (Chianti)
description: Made of 80% Sangiovese, 10% Canaiolo and 10% Malvasia Bianca, this opens with red-skinned fruit and an earthy underbrush aromas. The fresh, straightforward palate evokes red cherry and chopped herb, framed by smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Vina Robles 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: Pungent grassy notes lead the nose of this bottling from Vina Robles, with rounder passionfruit scents as well. The palate combines flinty minerality with lime zest, kumquat and herbal flavors, recalling its initial grassiness.

title: Von Strasser 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: This wine benefits from additions of 19% Malbec, 5% Petit Verdot and 1% Merlot, the floral nuances of these varieties providing layered fruitiness and subtle texture. Cinnamon, vanilla and raspberry flavors take on a tart, herbal personality as the medium-bodied wine opens in the glass.

title: Soléna 2015 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Barrel fermented and aged for 14 months in French oak, this enters with a nutty, toasty flavor around lighter fruit. Jicama, apple and white peach combine in the midpalate, then thin out quickly, with some bite to the finish.

title: Sparkman 2013 L'Autre Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Temperance Hill grapes are sourced for this Pinot Noir project. Barrel spices dominate, with tart berry fruit in the background. It's a solid effort, though it thins out and feels a bit stripped in the finish.

title: William Harrison 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Ripe blueberry and huckleberry flavors form a wall of fruitiness in this full-bodied, ready-to-enjoy red, offering a soft, simple layering of cedar and mocha.

title: Youngberg Hill Vineyards 2014 Bailey Block Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: The most recent planting at the estate vineyard gets its own designate. It's 100% Dijon 777 clone, and the flavors push stem and rock and forest floor front and center. For some tasters, that's enough; for others, a bit more actual fruit would be welcome. Right now it's a stiff, herbal wine that's already showing signs of drying out.

title: Tenute del Cerro 2013  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Subtle stewed black-skinned fruit, grilled herb and licorice aromas lead the nose. The subdued, lean palate offers raw cherry and espresso notes framed by close-grained tannins that grip the finish.

title: Poggio al Chiuso 2015  Chianti
description: Made of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo, this opens with rose and baking spice scents. The straightforward palate shows red plum and clove flavors, held firm with solid tannins. Drink through 2018.

title: Poggiotondo 2014  Chianti Superiore
description: The nose of this 85% Sangiovese, 10% Canaiolo and 5% Colorino Chianti shows muted black-skinned fruit and cooking spice aromas. The palate is easygoing, displaying black cherry, clove and vanilla flavors enveloped in mellow tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Poggiotondo 2015  Chianti
description: This blend of 85% Sangiovese, 10% Canaiolo and 5% Colorino shows delicate plum and underbrush aromas. It's medium-bodied, approachable and smoothly tannic, delivering prune and clove flavors. Drink through 2018.

title: Podere La Vigna 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: This has mocha, game and black-skinned berry aromas. The dense palate evokes cured meat, espresso and prune, framed by grainy, mouth puckering tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Podere Prospero 2013  Bolgheri
description: Made of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Franc, this has black-skinned fruit, game and scorched earth aromas. The dense palate delivers ripe black plum, toast and tobacco, its assertive tannins lending a rather astringent finish.

title: Salcheto 2015  Rosso di Montepulciano
description: Grilled herb, dark spice, toast and leather aromas lead the nose. The palate is vigorous, marked by orange zest, dried cherry and thyme notes held together by tightly wound tannins.

title: Valley View 2014 Pioneer Label Malbec (Oregon)
description: Besides the Malbec, there is also 12% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend. The grapes are from the Gold Vineyards in the Rogue Valley. Aged 13 months in French oak, it's showing a big burst of vanilla in both nose and flavor, along with cranberry fruit and some rugged dusty tannins. Another year of bottle age would help to integrate the oak a bit further.

title: Abadia Retuerta 2013 Pago Valdebellón Cabernet Sauvignon (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
description: Heavily herbal spicy leafy aromas are green like cool-climate Cab Franc, and then a massive bolt of oaky char takes over. This Cabernet Sauvignon is hard, drying and tough on the palate. Herbal roasted black-fruit flavors are smothered in burnt oak, while this is blackened but green tasting on the finish. Ripeness of fruit was clearly an issue in this cool vintage.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

title: André Kientzler 2014 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: The peel of Bosc pear and riper stone fruit are the chief aromatic markers of this wine. The palate is light, slight and crisp with an earthier, slightly bitter edge. Drink soon while aromas are at their height.

title: Château Meyre 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: Produced from organically grown grapes, the wine is fruity, lightly structured and developing quickly. It has generous black currants and black plums that are already attractive and crisp. There is a firm back drop of tannins. Drink from 2019.
